page.title: 09Milking - Coley Farm Colwich
page.content: In the milking parlour there is room for twelve cows, six on each side. As the cows on one side are finished they are replaced by six more. The milk from the cows goes into jars which have litres marked on. A good cow will give up to 30 litres each day. In the afternoon a cow will give less milk than in the morning. The cows are fed with a high protein food while they are milked. This gives 15-20 litres of milk each day, the rest comes from grass. The cows teats are sprayed with Iodine to reduce the risk of infection. The milk is pumped into a large cooled tank. Then the dairy lorry comes and empties the tank. Some of the milk is saved to suckle the calves so that they get some protection from their mothers. All the cows used for milking were pure Freisian.
